programme.title: The Breed
The Shield
programme.desc: The Breed: Directed by Nicholas Mastandrea. With Michelle Rodriguez, Oliver Hudson, Taryn Manning, Eric Lively. A group of five college kids are forced to match wits with unwelcoming residents when they fly to a "deserted" island for a party weekend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0455362/","name":"The Breed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjg5ODA5MzAxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzkyNDM2MTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of five college kids are forced to match wits with unwelcoming residents when they fly to a "deserted" island for a party weekend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0455362/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ThrownMuse"},"dateCreated":"2007-06-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stupid but entertaining","reviewBody":"A bunch of undergrads (played by 30 and 40somethings--no joke!) take their jet to an abandoned island for a vacation. Because undergrads do that? They get attacked by wild dogs that turn out to be genetically engineered killers. Scary! History has taught me to stay away from anything labeled "Wes Craven Presents," but I decided to check this out because how bad could a movie starring Michelle Rodriguez vs Killer Dogs be? Rodriguez isn't the best actress, but I always enjoy seeing her one-note tough-girl shtick in movies or TV (long live Ana Lucia!) And she does her own stunts in this! There's no CGI, which is commendable, though I'm not entirely sure how I feel about a large number of dogs being trained to attack for the sake of a dumb horror movie. And this is, indeed, a dumb horror movie. All the clichés are intact, the writing is awful, and there's even a dumb subplot about brotherly love. Or something. Taryn Manning is cast as the "hottie" of the group, though she looks washed-up and talks like she smokes six packs a day. There's an interesting subplot with her character that would have made the movie more interesting had it been expanded upon. This is enjoyable for what it is, but it's nothing special.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13037,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2008-01-30","keywords":"island,cabin in the woods,animal attack,survival,natural horror","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Breed (2006)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1938424089","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDJlZmNhMjItMGM4Zi00MGEyLThkNzUtZGJhY2MyOTQwNDVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDJlZmNhMjItMGM4Zi00MGEyLThkNzUtZGJhY2MyOTQwNDVjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from First Look Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735442/","name":"Michelle Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005029/","name":"Oliver Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0543383/","name":"Taryn Manning"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557608/","name":"Nicholas Mastandrea"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049118/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148083/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068448/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176256/","name":"Robert Conte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0941810/","name":"Peter Wortmann"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Totalcar
programme.desc: Najpopularnija mađarska emisija za sve ljubitelje automobila. Uživajte u zanimljivim i informativnim minutama ove serije! Najpopularnija mađarska emisija za sve ljubitelje automobila. Uživajte u zanimljivim i informativnim minutama ove serije!

programme.title: Profileri
programme.desc: Francuska serija pod nazivom "Profileri" predstavlja Chloé, kriminalističku psihologinju koja istražuje ubojice kako bi pomogla riješiti slučajeve zločina. Chloé Saint-Laurent je profiler i radi s policijskim timom za rješavanje ubojstva u Parizu. Ona je vrlo draga, nosi jako obojenu odjeću i veliku žutu torbu. Izgleda poput djevojčice koja treba lutku, ali je vrlo pametna i jako dobar profiler. Korak po korak, uklopit će se u tim a njezine kolege, u početku jako pridržane, postaju joj najbolji prijatelji.

programme.title: Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Nakon što se deset godina klonila profesionalnog svijeta, Candice Renoir, plavuša i majka četvero djece, vrhovna je zapovjednica skupine istražitelja. Candice Renoir ima četvero djece, a nije radila deset godina kako bi pratila njezinog muža u inozemstvu. Sada rastavljena od muža, preuzima posao voditeljice istražnog tima javne sigurnosti na jugu Francuske. Na čelu ovog novog tima, ona mora dokazati da je dobra u svom poslu. Iskustvo, vještina promatranja , analitičke sposobnosti i oštroumnost pomažu joj u rješavanju istraga.

programme.title: Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Nakon što se deset godina klonila profesionalnog svijeta, Candice Renoir, plavuša i majka četvero djece, vrhovna je zapovjednica skupine istražitelja. Candice Renoir ima četvero djece, a nije radila deset godina kako bi pratila njezinog muža u inozemstvu. Sada rastavljena od muža, preuzima posao voditeljice istražnog tima javne sigurnosti na jugu Francuske. Na čelu ovog novog tima, ona mora dokazati da je dobra u svom poslu. Iskustvo, vještina promatranja , analitičke sposobnosti i oštroumnost pomažu joj u rješavanju istraga.

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 2
Insidious: Chapter 2
programme.desc: Insidious: Chapter 2: Directed by James Wan. With Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Barbara Hershey, Lin Shaye. The Lamberts believe that they have defeated the spirits that have haunted their family, but they soon discover that evil is not beaten so easily." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2226417/","name":"Insidious: Chapter 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0OTA5ODIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTUzNDg4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Lamberts believe that they have defeated the spirits that have haunted their family, but they soon discover that evil is not beaten so easily.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2226417/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jaguiar313"},"dateCreated":"2013-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Insidious sequel is spooky fun.","reviewBody":"Insidious: Chapter 2 starts up almost right after the original Insidious ended with Josh (Patrick Wilson) and Renai (Rose Byrne) Lambert reunited with their son Dalton (Ty Simpkins) after his spirit was held prisoner by a demon in an afterlife dimension called 'The Further'. But, as we saw in the final frames, something else was now inhabiting Josh's body and it had strangled paranormal investigator Elise (Lin Shaye) to death. We pick up as the unsuspecting family, including older son Foster (Andrew Astor) and their infant daughter Kali, have moved in with Josh's mother Lorraine (Barbara Hershey) while police investigate Elise's mysterious death in their house. They are barely moved in when supernatural occurrences start to begin again with objects moving, spectral voices, apparitions appearing and dear old dad acting very strange. While Renai tries to deal with the fact that supernatural forces are still with them, Josh tries to convince her all is well and Lorraine decides to team up with Elise's former assistants paranormal investigators Specs (Leigh Whannell who also wrote the screenplay) and Tucker (Angus Sampson) along with one of the original investigators from Josh's childhood haunting, Carl (Steve Coulter) to get down to the bottom of these haunted hi-jinx once and for all. And that is all I will say about the story as, despite some familiar trappings, James Wan (The Conjuring) takes this installment in some clever directions and once again uses the familiar elements very well. We get to know the story behind the evil woman in black seen in the last film and even revisit The Further though, this time it is inventively linked to events in the first film. The pace is a bit slower and more methodical this time round but, since this film is a bit of a mystery as well as haunting, it takes it's time to let the story unfold and secrets be revealed. We still get some spooky scenes but, it is refreshingly mixed in with Lorraine and co's equally goose bump inducing investigation. And what they find is deviously fun. The film is not quite as lively as Insidious part one but, I liked the mystery element and the film earned points with me for using it's return to 'The Further' a bit more clever and less silly then last time. That is the point where the first film lost it's grip on me and here I like how it was done and was with this supernatural chiller up to the spooky end. Wan is a good director and he takes what could have been a ho-hum retread and makes it a fun follow-up. He gets good performances out of all his cast and while I found Patrick Wilson to be bland in both Insidious and The Conjuring, he gets a far more lively performance out of him here. He gets to ham it up a bit and it suits him. The film has some beautiful and creepy visuals, as is Wan's trademark, and Joseph Bishara's score adds some nice atmosphere too. So in conclusion, while the story elements are more familiar; we've seen some of it before and the pace a bit slower, Wan does give us a spooky mystery to add to the paranormal activity and makes much more clever use of his otherworldly 'Further'. He also gives us some clever answers to the questions left by his first Insidious and that all adds up to a spooky fun time at the movies. Also stars House Of The Devil's Joceline Donahue as young Lorraine in some equally clever flashback sequences that tie into the rest of the film in a fun way."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":164356,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-09-13","keywords":"police detective,barricading a door,injection in leg,taser,attacked with a knife","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4286163225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2ODQzODA0OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU4NjU4MTAx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2ODQzODA0OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU4NjU4MTAx._V1_.jpg","description":"A haunted family struggles to uncover a terrifying secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world in Insidious: Chapter 2."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933940/","name":"Patrick Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0126284/","name":"Rose Byrne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001347/","name":"Barbara Hershey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314851/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1191481/","name":"Leigh Whannell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2226417, Title: Insidious: Chapter 2, --- Description: Insidious: Chapter 2: Directed by James Wan. With Patrick Wilson, Rose Byrne, Barbara Hershey, Lin Shaye. The Lamberts believe that they have defeated the spirits that have haunted their family, but they soon discover that evil is not beaten so easily." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2226417/","name":"Insidious: Chapter 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0OTA5ODIxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTUzNDg4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Lamberts believe that they have defeated the spirits that have haunted their family, but they soon discover that evil is not beaten so easily.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2226417/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jaguiar313","dateCreated":"2013-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Insidious sequel is spooky fun.","reviewBody":"Insidious: Chapter 2 starts up almost right after the original Insidious ended with Josh (Patrick Wilson) and Renai (Rose Byrne) Lambert reunited with their son Dalton (Ty Simpkins) after his spirit was held prisoner by a demon in an afterlife dimension called 'The Further'. But, as we saw in the final frames, something else was now inhabiting Josh's body and it had strangled paranormal investigator Elise (Lin Shaye) to death. We pick up as the unsuspecting family, including older son Foster (Andrew Astor) and their infant daughter Kali, have moved in with Josh's mother Lorraine (Barbara Hershey) while police investigate Elise's mysterious death in their house. They are barely moved in when supernatural occurrences start to begin again with objects moving, spectral voices, apparitions appearing and dear old dad acting very strange. While Renai tries to deal with the fact that supernatural forces are still with them, Josh tries to convince her all is well and Lorraine decides to team up with Elise's former assistants paranormal investigators Specs (Leigh Whannell who also wrote the screenplay) and Tucker (Angus Sampson) along with one of the original investigators from Josh's childhood haunting, Carl (Steve Coulter) to get down to the bottom of these haunted hi-jinx once and for all. And that is all I will say about the story as, despite some familiar trappings, James Wan (The Conjuring) takes this installment in some clever directions and once again uses the familiar elements very well. We get to know the story behind the evil woman in black seen in the last film and even revisit The Further though, this time it is inventively linked to events in the first film. The pace is a bit slower and more methodical this time round but, since this film is a bit of a mystery as well as haunting, it takes it's time to let the story unfold and secrets be revealed. We still get some spooky scenes but, it is refreshingly mixed in with Lorraine and co's equally goose bump inducing investigation. And what they find is deviously fun. The film is not quite as lively as Insidious part one but, I liked the mystery element and the film earned points with me for using it's return to 'The Further' a bit more clever and less silly then last time. That is the point where the first film lost it's grip on me and here I like how it was done and was with this supernatural chiller up to the spooky end. Wan is a good director and he takes what could have been a ho-hum retread and makes it a fun follow-up. He gets good performances out of all his cast and while I found Patrick Wilson to be bland in both Insidious and The Conjuring, he gets a far more lively performance out of him here. He gets to ham it up a bit and it suits him. The film has some beautiful and creepy visuals, as is Wan's trademark, and Joseph Bishara's score adds some nice atmosphere too. So in conclusion, while the story elements are more familiar; we've seen some of it before and the pace a bit slower, Wan does give us a spooky mystery to add to the paranormal activity and makes much more clever use of his otherworldly 'Further'. He also gives us some clever answers to the questions left by his first Insidious and that all adds up to a spooky fun time at the movies. Also stars House Of The Devil's Joceline Donahue as young Lorraine in some equally clever flashback sequences that tie into the rest of the film in a fun way.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":164356,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-09-13","keywords":"police detective,barricading a door,injection in leg,taser,attacked with a knife","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"UK Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4286163225","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2ODQzODA0OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU4NjU4MTAx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2ODQzODA0OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU4NjU4MTAx._V1_.jpg","description":"A haunted family struggles to uncover a terrifying secret that has left them dangerously connected to the spirit world in Insidious: Chapter 2.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933940/","name":"Patrick Wilson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0126284/","name":"Rose Byrne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001347/","name":"Barbara Hershey"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314851/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051618/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1191481/","name":"Leigh Whannell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1490123/","name":"James Wan"],"duration":"PT1H46M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc: Navy SEAL američka je serija o članovima najelitnije specijalne jedinice koji kreću u opasne misije boreći se protiv terorizma. Navy SEAL serija je o pripadnicima najelitnije specijalne jedinice koji kreću u opasne i riskantne misije u koje ih domovina šalje. Njihov je cilj uništiti terorizam, a tim dobro obučenih vojnika suočava se s time svakodnevno.Uz napete trenutke ove serije, saznajte ishod tajnih misija ovih hrabrih vojnika!

programme.title: Mornarički specijalci
programme.desc: Navy SEAL američka je serija o članovima najelitnije specijalne jedinice koji kreću u opasne misije boreći se protiv terorizma. Navy SEAL serija je o pripadnicima najelitnije specijalne jedinice koji kreću u opasne i riskantne misije u koje ih domovina šalje. Njihov je cilj uništiti terorizam, a tim dobro obučenih vojnika suočava se s time svakodnevno.Uz napete trenutke ove serije, saznajte ishod tajnih misija ovih hrabrih vojnika!

programme.title: Tehnološke Igračke
programme.desc: Dokumentarna serija "Tehnološke igračke" vodi vas u svijet tehnologije, upoznaje gledatelje pred malim ekranima s mnogim prometnim inovacijama. Dokumentarna serija "Tehnološke igračke" vodi vas u svijet tehnologije, upoznaje gledatelje pred malim ekranima s mnogim prometnim inovacijama. Zajedno otputujte u svijet visoke tehnologije u kojoj možete otkriti niz revolucionarnih izuma i vozila iz budućnosti. Ako ste ljubitelj tehnologije, opustite se i uživajte u ovoj seriji!

programme.title: Gran Hotel
Grand Hotel
programme.desc: Gran Hotel: With Adriana Ozores, Amaia Salamanca, Yon González, Eloy Azorín. A family-owned hotel in the fictional coastal Spanish town of Cantaloa in 1905: love, blackmail, jealousies, crime, comedy, and plots and counter-plots all involving the hotel's owners, guests, detectives, and residential employees." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2006421/","name":"Gran Hotel","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTk2MjQyNTAzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODI3OTM3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family-owned hotel in the fictional coastal Spanish town of Cantaloa in 1905: love, blackmail, jealousies, crime, comedy, and plots and counter-plots all involving the hotel's owners, guests, detectives, and residential employees.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2006421/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"iammelba"},"dateCreated":"2018-06-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Couldn't stop at just one episode.","reviewBody":"This show is sooooooo addicting. The twists and turns throughout every single episode leaves you sitting on the edge of your seat. The show is so riveting that you forget you're reading subtitles. And just when I thought I had every character figured out, another twist happens. \n\nI enjoyed this series so much that I just may go back and watch it all again.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10000,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2011-10-04","keywords":"telenovela,spain","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654841/","name":"Adriana Ozores"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2319146/","name":"Amaia Salamanca"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2304398/","name":"Yon González"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0249391/"}]}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Artist
Umjetnik
programme.desc: The Artist: Directed by Michel Hazanavicius. With Jean Dujardin, Bérénice Bejo, John Goodman, James Cromwell. An egomaniacal film star develops a relationship with a young dancer against the backdrop of Hollywood's silent era." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1655442/","name":"The Artist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDUyZWU5N2UtOWFlMy00MTI0LTk0ZDYtMzFhNjljODBhZDA5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzA4ODc3ODU@._V1_.jpg","description":"An egomaniacal film star develops a relationship with a young dancer against the backdrop of Hollywood's silent era.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1655442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"littlemartinarocena"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Breath Of Fresh Vintage Air","reviewBody":"What a treat. I left the theater sort of floating. Delighted. A European film looking back at Hollywood better than Hollywood has been able to do for years. "A Star Is Born" and "Singing In The Rain" mixed in a glorious black and white cocktail. Silent, yes silent! But with a fabulous score and so much panache. Jean Dujardin is the revelation of the year. What a performance! Running the gamut of emotions, leaving us breathless, and if this wasn't enough, a rousing tap dance routine in the style of Fred Astaire and Eleanor Powell, partnering with the wonderful Berenice Bejo. I know that it's not just me. The audience applauded and cheered as the end credits rolled.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":236997,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-10-12","keywords":"homage,showbiz comedy,1920s,silent film,movie studio","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3105725977","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjcyNzMxMTA2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDcyNzcwNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjcyNzMxMTA2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDcyNzcwNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hollywood, 1927: As silent movie star George Valentin wonders if the arrival of talking pictures will cause him to fade into oblivion, he sparks with Peppy Miller, a young dancer set for a big break. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0241121/","name":"Jean Dujardin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0067367/","name":"Bérénice Bejo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0210188/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0006560/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169450/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

When a high school teacher is asked a question in class about Jesus, her response lands her in deep trouble." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4824308/","name":"God's Not Dead 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTExMDk4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODM0MDczNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a high school teacher is asked a question in class about Jesus, her response lands her in deep trouble.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4824308/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chrispike-21430"},"dateCreated":"2016-04-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Somehow I miss Kevin Sorbo","reviewBody":"For those wondering if it's worse than the first one.... wonder no more, it certainly is. 

This film is set in an alternate reality, in which the United States is run by smug, douche bag atheists. In this world, Christians are persecuted against in all aspects or life, Christians are all classy, attractive, happy, and non judgmental individuals. 

Melissa Joan Hart is a teacher, she dares to mentioned Jesus in class, the establishment is outraged, she must be taken down. What follows is a ridiculous court farce, in this court, no one knows what the constitution is, and all those smug atheists have a serious bee in their bonnet. 

I won't spoil the ending.... but needless to say, it is something more akin to a fantasy novel."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12234,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-04-01","keywords":"christian propaganda,manipulation,alternate universe,christian film,grammatically incorrect title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3818435097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3OTg0MDAxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY5NTAyNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3OTg0MDAxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY5NTAyNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official trailer for God's Not Dead 2 from Pure Flix."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004997/","name":"Melissa Joan Hart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0582462/","name":"Jesse Metcalfe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0924684/","name":"David A.R. Koncert
programme.desc:
Le concert: Directed by Radu Mihaileanu. With Aleksey Guskov, Dmitriy Nazarov, Mélanie Laurent, François Berléand. Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320082/","name":"Le concert","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwNDc5MzYtYjYxMy00OGE5LWI3YmQtN2RmZDU2ZWNhMjFhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM5Mjc1MDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danielp-630-591956"},"dateCreated":"2010-01-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"20 years post-1989 encapsulated in 2 hours","reviewBody":"The movie gives you an accurate feel for what it feels to struggle to survive and find your way in post-communist Eastern Europe. The tragedy of the past is still present and yet the human nature freed up from restrictions turns in completely unexpected directions. The only way to escape the day-time TV feel is to bring in plenty of sense of humor.

Radu Mihaileanu creates a master piece. I can vouch that it captures the crazy spirit of the last 20 years and the need to make sense of it all. The resolution of the movie is childish and so there were the hopes and dreams of us all in 1989.

The movie is a modern fairy tale told with harsh truths and love and compassion.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17862,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2009-11-04","keywords":"russian,france,the weinstein company,orchestra,concert","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Concert","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2727544345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMjg4NTE5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI5NTg4MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMjg4NTE5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI5NTg4MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"During the communist era, AndreÃ¯ Filipov was fired as the conductor of Moscow's Bolshoi Orchestra for refusing to fire all Jewish performers. programme.title: It's Complicated
Samac
programme.desc: It's Complicated: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Meryl Streep, Steve Martin, Alec Baldwin, John Krasinski. When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1230414/","name":"It's Complicated","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0NjM2NTI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ2MDc5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1230414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barrys82"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Watch it just for its cast","reviewBody":"The name of the movie is It's Complicated but the film is everything but complicated, in fact this is the simplest and lightest movie I've seen in a very long time. It's Complicated follows the story of Jane (Streep) that during her son's graduation hooks up with her ex-husband Jake (Baldwin)and at the same time she is dating Adam, her architect. The movie has some good moments of humor but the situations tends to repeat over and over making the movie a little boring. The story is kinda predictable and the plot is a bit lame and corny but the movie is worthy because of its cast. Actors like Alec Baldwin and Steve Maritn and an actress like Meryl Streep make it a real joy. Their performances are excellent and so funny. In conclusion, It's complicated is a movie mostly intended for people over 30's and 40's. Women will love it and men will enjoy it also","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89907,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-03","keywords":"mature romance,female protagonist,lovers,ex husband ex wife rekindling their relationship,divorced couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It's Complicated -- International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1404699929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTc0NjU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc0MTM5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTc0NjU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc0MTM5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic comedy in which a divorced man (Baldwin) vies for the affection of his ex-wife (Streep), who is being courted by an architect (Martin)."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114441/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Deep
Oto: Istraživač dubina
programme.desc: Deep: Directed by Julio Soto Gurpide. With Justin Felbinger, Stephen Hughes, Lindsey Alena, Elisabeth Gray. In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two unconditional friends: Evo, a nerdy and clumsy angler fish, and Alice, a neurotic deep-sea shrimp. When an accident destroys their home, the guardian of the abyss, The Kraken, will send Deep and his friends on a perilous journey to find a new home. In their mission, they will be joined by Maura -a voracious moray eel- and together they will travel to amazing places like the submerged city of New York, the Titanic or the Arctic, facing formidable enemies and hilarious situations. Will they be able to bring the oceans back to their former glory?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4105584/","name":"Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmQ0MWYzZjYtNGFiNS00MjE4LTliODUtMTFhOGIwMzY0ZWFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjcwODQ2Nzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two uncondition","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4105584/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lurael"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice story, poor execution","reviewBody":"I'll give it a solid 4. The storyline is nice, but the writing is so poor, and obviously nobody bothered to look at the details and refinments. IMDb data; ttnr: 4105584, Title: Deep, --- Description: Deep: Directed by Julio Soto Gurpide. With Justin Felbinger, Stephen Hughes, Lindsey Alena, Elisabeth Gray. In 2100, when humanity has abandoned the earth, a colony of extravagant creatures still thrives in the deepest abyss of the ocean. Deep, an adventurous "dumbo" octopus and the last one of his kind lives there with his two unconditional friends: Evo, a nerdy and clumsy angler fish, and Alice, a neurotic deep-sea shrimp. When an accident destroys their home, the guardian of the abyss, The Kraken, will send Deep and his friends on a perilous journey to find a new home. In their mission, they will be joined by Maura -a voracious moray eel- and together they will travel to amazing places like the submerged city of New York, the Titanic or the Arctic, facing formidable enemies and hilarious situations. programme.title: The Bank Job
Pljačka
programme.desc:
The Bank Job: Directed by Roger Donaldson. With Jason Statham, Saffron Burrows, Stephen Campbell Moore, Daniel Mays. Martine offers Terry a lead on a foolproof bank hit on London's Baker Street. She targets a roomful of safe deposit boxes worth millions in cash and jewelry along with a treasure trove of dirty secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0200465/","name":"The Bank Job","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmE2NzEyOWItYjI1ZC00YWZhLWI2MjEtZmU1NjIyNjliOTkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Martine offers Terry a lead on a foolproof bank hit on London's Baker Street. She targets a roomful of safe deposit boxes worth millions in cash and jewelry along with a treasure trove of dirty secrets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0200465/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ericjams"},"dateCreated":"2008-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Above Average Caper Flick","reviewBody":"As caper flicks go, all I really hope for is something that succeeds in being both novel and entertaining. My hopes were satisfied by The Bank Job. The plot itself is based very loosely on events that occurred in the 1970s in London. The royal family has some dark secrets. An outspoken activist/petty criminal/drug importer has evidence of these secrets, which he uses as leverage against the government who desperately wants to prosecute him. This evidence is stored in a safety deposit box within a London bank. British Intelligence conjures up a rather reckless plan of employing a bunch of two-bit/amateur criminals to break into the vault, and take the evidence along with whatever else they can carry out. Apart from one intermediary, none of the robbers know the government's secret agenda. Of course, things get complicated whenever the possibility that a bunch of dirty secrets are in the wrong hands, and eventually the movie juggles several interconnecting plot lines, all related to the contents of the vault and their implication on various interests from the royal family, to corrupt police, to the sexual indiscretions of parliament members.

The movie keeps a good pace and never takes itself too seriously. It builds up the plot lines and tries somewhat successfully to tie everything together. There is some good tension, a bit of violence (not much), and eventually, vindication for most of the parties.

The problems with the movie are numerous, but nothing that ultimately destroys the fun. Yes the movie is rife with inexplicably, unnecessary side characters (see female undercover agent in the Caribbean). Yes the movie's dialogue veers into indecipherable 1970s British slang, which gives a comedic undertone to conversations that are intended to be serious. Yes there exist rampant plot issues that make you wonder how stupid cops really are. And yes the acting is OK, at best, lets face it Jason Stracham is meant for British caper movies the way Keanu Reeves is meant to play a clueless surfer cop in Point Break - so while he's not winning any Academies, he fits these rolls just fine.

You could wait for the DVD, or if you are looking for a fun way to kill 2 hours, you should go to the theater for this one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":178307,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2009-01-28","keywords":"safe deposit,heist,chase,mobster,london england","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004787/","name":"Saffron Burrows"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1304386/","name":"Stephen Campbell Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002044/","name":"Roger Donaldson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037759/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0166074/","name":"Dick Clement"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0478588/","name":"Ian La Frenais"}],"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Le concert
Koncert
programme.desc:
Le concert: Directed by Radu Mihaileanu. With Aleksey Guskov, Dmitriy Nazarov, Mélanie Laurent, François Berléand. Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320082/","name":"Le concert","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTMwNDc5MzYtYjYxMy00OGE5LWI3YmQtN2RmZDU2ZWNhMjFhL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjM5Mjc1MDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Thirty years ago Bolshoi Orchestra conductor Andreï Filipov was fired for hiring Jewish musicians. Now a lowly janitor, an opportunity arises to gather his old musicians to go and pose as the official Buolshoi orchestra in Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"danielp-630-591956"},"dateCreated":"2010-01-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"20 years post-1989 encapsulated in 2 hours","reviewBody":"The movie gives you an accurate feel for what it feels to struggle to survive and find your way in post-communist Eastern Europe. The tragedy of the past is still present and yet the human nature freed up from restrictions turns in completely unexpected directions. The only way to escape the day-time TV feel is to bring in plenty of sense of humor.

Radu Mihaileanu creates a master piece. I can vouch that it captures the crazy spirit of the last 20 years and the need to make sense of it all. The resolution of the movie is childish and so there were the hopes and dreams of us all in 1989.

The movie is a modern fairy tale told with harsh truths and love and compassion.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":17862,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2009-11-04","keywords":"russian,france,the weinstein company,orchestra,concert","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Concert","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2727544345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMjg4NTE5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI5NTg4MjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMjg4NTE5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDI5NTg4MjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"During the communist era, AndreÃ¯ Filipov was fired as the conductor of Moscow's Bolshoi Orchestra for refusing to fire all Jewish performers. programme.title: Vykradena pryntsesa: Ruslan i Lyudmyla
Ukradena princeza
programme.desc:
Vykradena pryntsesa: Ruslan i Lyudmyla: Directed by Oleh Malamuzh. With Nadezhda Dorofeeva, Aleksey Zavgorodniy, Yevhen Malukha, Serhiy Prytula. A story from the age of valiant knights, beautiful princesses, and evil sorcerers. The first thoughts I had with this movie. Let's talk about it's good points: the ideas, and many present themselves well. What caught me was this scene with food attacking the princess. I won't lie simple scenes throughout the movie were actually impressive, but they only survived as solo ideas, and not so much as a complete film. Problems.... animation felt stiff at times, some shots were odd compositions, and the characters felt like plastic more than like soft skin. Pacing sometimes was awkward.

In the first 15 minutes of the film they did a bit of copy and paste from Disney's Aladdin. (I almost never accuse anyone of that unless it is THAT obvious, sorry it kinda was)

At the 20 minute mark things did get better, but by then you're audience is probably turned away, or very uncomfortable.

Sorry, but I'm hoping that Wizart will have better luck with this fairytale in 2020.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2372,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Animation","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2018-03-07","keywords":"strong female character,fairy tale,princess,evil sorcerer,kidnapping","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer Vykradena pryntsesa: Ruslan i Ludmila","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2197797657","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzliMmExZmUtM2ZkZC00OThmLWE1NGQtMTIyZGNhZDU3ZmU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzliMmExZmUtM2ZkZC00OThmLWE1NGQtMTIyZGNhZDU3ZmU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5620468/","name":"Nadezhda Dorofeeva"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5620869/","name":"Aleksey Zavgorodniy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3397184/","name":"Yevhen Malukha"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7884525/","name":"Oleh Malamuzh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0544447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0085769/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0376256/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701090/","name":"Alexander Pushkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7760581/","name":"Yaroslav Voytseshek"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Polaroid
Polaroid
programme.desc:
Polaroid: Directed by Lars Klevberg. With Kathryn Prescott, Tyler Young, Samantha Logan, Keenan Tracey. High school loner Bird Fitcher has no idea what dark secrets are tied to the Polaroid camera she finds. It doesn't take long to discover that those who have their picture taken with it, soon die." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5598292/","name":"Polaroid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU2MDI0NDYxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDAxOTQxMjI@._V1_.jpg","description":"High school loner Bird Fitcher has no idea what dark secrets are tied to the Polaroid camera she finds. It doesn't take long to discover that those who have their picture taken with it, soon die.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5598292/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TwistedContent"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Generic Endeavour for A Horror Buff","reviewBody":""Polaroid" is an arguably good-looking, all-the-clichés-rehashing mainstream paranormal horror flick, which offers some entertainment and cheap teen scares.

For my 930th horror film "Polaroid" makes a painfully average entry in the list. The good things here are as follows: decent acting, alright characters, some okay scare sequences, itsy bitsy twisty plot etc., etc. But, the good things become not-so-good things when You've seen them a hundred times before. The characters and the plot come from an uninspired, unoriginal script, it's quite predictable and the twists have little to no impact. The scares are disappointingly whack, except for two or three creative sequences. It's just... not a wholesome movie at all. The concept itself is cool & there's potential in it, but the writer chose to give in to all the Hollywood-ish ways instead of trying to stand out. The cinematography's cold and smokey, not a lot of complaints there. What else... The original score is there and it works, but it's as uninspirined as the plot.

Objectivily, it's definitely a 5/10, subjectively I'd want to give it less. I do recommend this to anyone who's not calling himself a horror fan & to all the teens that need a late night light horror flick, "Polaroid" makes a decent pg-13 rated horror. All in all, a disappointing expierence. I hope Lars Klevberg does a better job on "Child's Play", I really do.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13141,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-09-17","keywords":"polaroid camera,polaroid,teenage girl,female photographer,female protagonist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi198687001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIyMjk1MDItNjdlNS00MmVmLTg4ZTktNTU1OWI2MWFiNGYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjIyMjk1MDItNjdlNS00MmVmLTg4ZTktNTU1OWI2MWFiNGYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"High school loner Bird Fitcher has no idea what dark secrets are tied to the mysterious Polaroid vintage camera she stumbles upon, but it doesn't take long to discover that those who have their picture taken meet a tragic end."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3077071/","name":"Kathryn Prescott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5683678/","name":"Tyler Young"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3693092/","name":"Samantha Logan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2209002/","name":"Lars Klevberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044439/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0530939/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1397455/","name":"Blair Butler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2209002/","name":"Lars Klevberg"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mon chien Stupide
Moj pas Blesavi
programme.desc:
Mon chien Stupide: Directed by Yvan Attal. With Yvan Attal, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Eric Ruf, Pascale Arbillot. Henri is a middle-aged writer in crisis. Just at a time when he assesses of his life, an enormous gray dog, impolite and smelly, sneaks into Henri's house." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10143498/","name":"Mon chien Stupide","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTFhNDlhZmItMDlkMS00MDc3LWE0OTEtMmJhNWJjYTJjMzI5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODQyNDU4OTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Henri is a middle-aged writer in crisis. Just at a time when he assesses of his life, an enormous gray dog, impolite and smelly, sneaks into Henri's house.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10143498/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ulicknormanowen"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Hot dog.","reviewBody":"The first part deftly blends comedy with drama;director/actor Attal uses a classic comic situation for something it was not meant for: the (very big) dog settles down in a bourgeois house and the family cannot get rid of this burdensome animal ; but dad ,a writer who has been suffering from cramp for years , is fed up with his depressed wife (Charlotte Gainsbourg) and his restless offspring : three boys and a girl ;the dog becomes his true mate ,he calls him "Stupid" (in the title ,it's really a proper noun).There's a lot of humor ,as this dog has a tendency to sexually assault the male persons;although Attal uses and abuses the voice over to tell us how he feels nostagic for his days in Rome ,where he was able to let his inspiration flow, but it was before he was a family man,the movie survives the intellectual intentions .

With a few exceptions,the second part is preachy,edifying ,sophomoric and dull ,as tedious as Miss Gainsbourg's lecture on Musset' "Lorenzaccio" ; the story becomes predictable , implausible (the essays ), and " you -shall- be- a- man ,my son " in the grand tradition of Kipling; all the lines between the born again writer and his editor have been heard at least a hundred times or more by the average viewer: it's the last line , thanks one more time to this good old dog ,which saves it from the pure cliché .It's also the presence of the pet which saves the improbable scene between the professor and the writer .The story drags on and on , with a little help from the music ,a lovely variation on Lennon/McCartney's "and I love her"in the last sequences,nicely filmed .

Dedicated to director Claude Berri.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1652,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-10-30","keywords":"writer,family conflict,dysfunctional family,dog humping,dog humping someone's leg","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3854548505","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdlYWJhNGItOWJmYS00N2ZmLTliNTYtZjhkYmRlNWJiMjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjdlYWJhNGItOWJmYS00N2ZmLTliNTYtZjhkYmRlNWJiMjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040939/","name":"Yvan Attal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001250/","name":"Charlotte Gainsbourg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0749222/","name":"Eric Ruf"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040939/","name":"Yvan Attal"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0151426/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0723475/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0771313/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266899/","name":"John Fante"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1918877/","name":"Dean Craig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0040939/","name":"Yvan Attal"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bombshell
Skandalozno: Neispričana priča National Enquirera
programme.desc:
Bombshell: Directed by Jay Roach. With Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie, John Lithgow. A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6394270/","name":"Bombshell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjlhOWE3YjktY2MzOC00ZmQ1LWIwNjgtZmVhZmFjZGExMzgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6394270/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gradyharp"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"'He's about as flirty as the grizzly from The Revenant'","reviewBody":"It takes courage to place this true story before the public at this time of the political climate during debates by presidential candidates and retorts from the sitting president who is famous for his association with Fox News. Charles Randolph (The Big Short, and The Life of David Gale) has written a penetrating screenplay about the 2016 explosion when Fox News persona Roger Ailes was finally exposed for sexual harassment by some courageous women. Director Jay Roach (Trumbo, Blown Away, Austin Powers: International Man Of Mystery, etc) makes this story come vividly to life, unafraid to insert film clips of Donald Trump's appearances as the case unfolds, as well as including the lesbian relationships that give the story a new grounding.

The story of this Fox News scandal is true, so everyone knows the outline. As one distillation states, 'When Gretchen Carlson (Nicole Kidman) slaps Fox News founder Roger Ailes (John Lithgow) with a lawsuit alleging sexual harassment, not a soul could predict what would happen next. Her decision leads to Fox News correspondent Megyn Kelly (Charlize Theron) coming forward with her own story, as well as multiple other women, such as Kayla Pospisil (Margot Robbie), inciting a movement that reverberates around the world.'

The cast is outstanding: Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, and Margot Robbie each excel, but the other women in the film - Allison Janney, Connie Britton, Liv Hewson, Kate McKinnon, and Brigette Lundy-Paine - also impress. John Lithgow is very appropriately repugnant as Roger Ailes, as is Malcolm McDowell as Rupert Murdoch, and the clips of Giuliani, Trump et al. The tension never lets up as this scandal is related in fine form. Not only is the film excellent (though some may prefer the Showtime series THE LOUDEST VOICE account of the scandal), but also it offers award winning quality performances that allow the actors to step into different territories.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":104813,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-20","keywords":"photograph,republican party,scandal,tv news,sexual harassment","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2331492121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bombshell - In theaters December 2019. Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie, John Lithgow, Kate McKinnon, Connie Britton, Mark Duplass, Rob Delaney, Malcolm McDowell, Allison Janney."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000173/","name":"Nicole Kidman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005366/","name":"Jay Roach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465018/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1017488/","name":"Charles Randolph"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Far from Heaven
Daleko od raja
programme.desc:
Far from Heaven: Directed by Todd Haynes. With Julianne Moore, Dennis Quaid, Dennis Haysbert, Patricia Clarkson. In 1950s Connecticut, a flustered housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0297884/","name":"Far from Heaven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTE5ODI3MTM4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjE5OTg2._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1950s Connecticut, a flustered housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0297884/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red_Identity"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Incredible film with amazing ambition and visual style","reviewBody":"I decided to seek this one out because of Julianne Moore. I thought it would be just another well-acted period drama. What I didn't know was that Todd Haynes was behind it, and from the opening the film lets you know what kind of style it will be. It's not one of those stuffy period dramas. In fact, it's very much made in the style of actual 1950s films. It's apparently taking on the style of Douglas Sirks' films, and even though I have never seen one, the style is apparent. 

This is the definition of a melodrama, but it serves the purpose completely and not the type of melodrama you would expect in this day and age. Everything is heightened in it's intensity. The incredible cinematography and use of colors is something to marvel at, and in terms of how the cinematography was constructed I don't think any other film could compare to. The beautiful music score is perfect and it only makes the atmosphere richer. All of this serves as a backdrop to a film that's really about contemporary issues in the 50s. That in itself has been the focus of many films in the last few years, but Far From Heaven stands apart from them all. The screenplay is brilliantly written, infusing rich backgrounds and characterization to all of the characters. In fact, the plot is pretty straight-forward and something you would see in classic films of that era, but now it feels fresh, alive with excitement. It's never depressing, and instead it tells its story until a satisfying conclusion. It's probably one of the best screenplays of its decade.

The performances are also perfect. But Julianne Moore tops off this perfection. I was surprised by how little "big" scenes she has. I would have expected this film to, but then again that's just another surprise. She embodies this character completely, and now that we have all of these flawed and unlikable leads, here we have one who we can easily call a "hero". Someone who others could look up to, we instantly connect with Moore. 

Overall, Far From Heaven is the 2nd Haynes film I have seen (the other being I'm Not There), and still his ambition is as apparent as ever. This feels as unique of a film as one could hope for."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45596,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-05-07","keywords":"gossip,homosexual,gay kiss,hate crime,domestic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Far From Heaven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2359689497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEyMmEwOTUtOTk1Yi00YTU0LTg2YjktOTUzZTMwODJkOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEyMmEwOTUtOTk1Yi00YTU0LTg2YjktOTUzZTMwODJkOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000598/","name":"Dennis Quaid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371660/","name":"Dennis Haysbert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042766/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Le prince oublié: Directed by Michel Hazanavicius. With Omar Sy, Bérénice Bejo, François Damiens, Sarah Gaye. Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8335482/","name":"Le prince oublié","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTJiZWEyNDMtNWNjOC00ZGJhLWExZjYtOTRhZmNlNjg0YzEyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Every night as Sofia falls asleep, her father Djibi takes her into "Storyland", a fantasy film studio where their extraordinary fairy-tale adventures come to life starring Djibi in the lead role as the heroic Prince Charming.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8335482/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"isaacochoterena"},"dateCreated":"2021-10-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining but with rare moments","reviewBody":"In this film the plot is well constructed, although the ending is unsatisfactory.

The theme of growing up, maturing and how parents perceive it in their children is exposed. There are very good things like some special effects, how the story tells and how the brain perceives the phenomenon of growing up. Although there are times when it looks a bit like Inside Out and Toy Story, the ending feels empty and the closing is unsatisfactory.

It is a movie with a good message about growing up and with a good story to tell, but the ending ruins what was previously built.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1149,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2020-02-12","keywords":"night","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [English SUB]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3936402969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5ZGU3M2QtMjMyYS00NDJlLTgyZGUtN2I4NmMxYjliYmYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzM5ZGU3M2QtMjMyYS00NDJlLTgyZGUtN2I4NmMxYjliYmYwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1082477/","name":"Omar Sy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0067367/","name":"Bérénice Bejo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1460782/","name":"François Damiens"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0775436/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1315212/","name":"Bruno Merle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380548/","name":"Noé Debré"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371890/","name":"Michel Hazanavicius"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: La mala educación
Loš odgoj
programme.desc:
La mala educación: Directed by Pedro Almodóvar. With Gael García Bernal, Fele Martínez, Daniel Giménez Cacho, Lluís Homar. An examination on the effect of Franco-era religious schooling and sexual abuse on the lives of two longtime friends." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0275491/","name":"La mala educación","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmFjNWU1YjMtOWVhZC00OGI4LTgwN2UtNDQ1ODMxZGZmZTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA0MjU0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An examination on the effect of Franco-era religious schooling and sexual abuse on the lives of two longtime friends.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0275491/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michelerealini"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very dark","reviewBody":"It is a very good film, although not as absolutely great as "Todo sobre my madre" and "Hable con ella"... Maybe because "Mala education" is sadder and darker than the previous Almodòvar films, the theme (the child abuse during college years) is disturbing and depressing, of course.

Almodòvar chooses this time a "noir" story. Enrique, a young movie director, looks for ideas for his next film. By chance he meets Ignacio, an old fellow of the college and his first love. Ignacio gives him a tale written by him, about the sexual abuses on him made by a priest during his childhood, in the college. This will be the inspiration for Enrique's movie, but the director will discover another dramatic truth...

In this film the gay element -which exists in all the Almodòvar's movies- comes back, stronger than in his last films. But above all there's the child rape problem, this is one of the most delicate themes the Spanish director has ever talked about. And naturally "Mala educacion" is one of his most tragic films. Whereas in the previous movies Almodòvar always let a place for hope, with this film it's not the case. That's why it is a very difficult tale to watch.

Cinematography is excellent, the music as well (with many recalls to the Sixties songs). Actors are also very good. For Gael Garcia Bernal (we saw him recently in "Motorcycle diaries") this is another solid effort. He portrays Ignacio, he enters the Almodòvar world with all the ambiguity required."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":58061,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"NC-17","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2004-03-19","keywords":"sex with a priest,sexual abuse,pubic hair,pederasty,masturbation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305558/","name":"Gael García Bernal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0555093/","name":"Fele Martínez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194572/","name":"Javier Cámara"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000264/","name":"Pedro Almodóvar"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071913/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0006440/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071642/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000264/","name":"Pedro Almodóvar"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Far from Heaven
Daleko od raja
programme.desc:
Far from Heaven: Directed by Todd Haynes. With Julianne Moore, Dennis Quaid, Dennis Haysbert, Patricia Clarkson. In 1950s Connecticut, a flustered housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0297884/","name":"Far from Heaven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTE5ODI3MTM4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjE5OTg2._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1950s Connecticut, a flustered housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0297884/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red_Identity"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Incredible film with amazing ambition and visual style","reviewBody":"I decided to seek this one out because of Julianne Moore. I thought it would be just another well-acted period drama. What I didn't know was that Todd Haynes was behind it, and from the opening the film lets you know what kind of style it will be. It's not one of those stuffy period dramas. In fact, it's very much made in the style of actual 1950s films. It's apparently taking on the style of Douglas Sirks' films, and even though I have never seen one, the style is apparent. 

This is the definition of a melodrama, but it serves the purpose completely and not the type of melodrama you would expect in this day and age. Everything is heightened in it's intensity. The incredible cinematography and use of colors is something to marvel at, and in terms of how the cinematography was constructed I don't think any other film could compare to. The beautiful music score is perfect and it only makes the atmosphere richer. All of this serves as a backdrop to a film that's really about contemporary issues in the 50s. That in itself has been the focus of many films in the last few years, but Far From Heaven stands apart from them all. The screenplay is brilliantly written, infusing rich backgrounds and characterization to all of the characters. In fact, the plot is pretty straight-forward and something you would see in classic films of that era, but now it feels fresh, alive with excitement. It's never depressing, and instead it tells its story until a satisfying conclusion. It's probably one of the best screenplays of its decade.

The performances are also perfect. But Julianne Moore tops off this perfection. I was surprised by how little "big" scenes she has. I would have expected this film to, but then again that's just another surprise. She embodies this character completely, and now that we have all of these flawed and unlikable leads, here we have one who we can easily call a "hero". Someone who others could look up to, we instantly connect with Moore. 

Overall, Far From Heaven is the 2nd Haynes film I have seen (the other being I'm Not There), and still his ambition is as apparent as ever. This feels as unique of a film as one could hope for."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45596,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-05-07","keywords":"gossip,homosexual,gay kiss,hate crime,domestic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Far From Heaven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2359689497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEyMmEwOTUtOTk1Yi00YTU0LTg2YjktOTUzZTMwODJkOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEyMmEwOTUtOTk1Yi00YTU0LTg2YjktOTUzZTMwODJkOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000598/","name":"Dennis Quaid"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371660/","name":"Dennis Haysbert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042766/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

In 1950s Connecticut, a flustered housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0297884/","name":"Far from Heaven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTE5ODI3MTM4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjE5OTg2._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1950s Connecticut, a flustered housewife faces a marital crisis and mounting racial tensions in the outside world.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0297884/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Red_Identity","dateCreated":"2012-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Incredible film with amazing ambition and visual style","reviewBody":"I decided to seek this one out because of Julianne Moore. I thought it would be just another well-acted period drama. What I didn't know was that Todd Haynes was behind it, and from the opening the film lets you know what kind of style it will be. It's not one of those stuffy period dramas. In fact, it's very much made in the style of actual 1950s films. It's apparently taking on the style of Douglas Sirks' films, and even though I have never seen one, the style is apparent. 

This is the definition of a melodrama, but it serves the purpose completely and not the type of melodrama you would expect in this day and age. Everything is heightened in it's intensity. The incredible cinematography and use of colors is something to marvel at, and in terms of how the cinematography was constructed I don't think any other film could compare to. The beautiful music score is perfect and it only makes the atmosphere richer. All of this serves as a backdrop to a film that's really about contemporary issues in the 50s. That in itself has been the focus of many films in the last few years, but Far From Heaven stands apart from them all. The screenplay is brilliantly written, infusing rich backgrounds and characterization to all of the characters. In fact, the plot is pretty straight-forward and something you would see in classic films of that era, but now it feels fresh, alive with excitement. It's never depressing, and instead it tells its story until a satisfying conclusion. It's probably one of the best screenplays of its decade.

The performances are also perfect. But Julianne Moore tops off this perfection. I was surprised by how little "big" scenes she has. I would have expected this film to, but then again that's just another surprise. She embodies this character completely, and now that we have all of these flawed and unlikable leads, here we have one who we can easily call a "hero". Someone who others could look up to, we instantly connect with Moore. 

Overall, Far From Heaven is the 2nd Haynes film I have seen (the other being I'm Not There), and still his ambition is as apparent as ever. This feels as unique of a film as one could hope for.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":45596,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-05-07","keywords":"gossip,homosexual,gay kiss,hate crime,domestic violence","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Far From Heaven","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2359689497","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEyMmEwOTUtOTk1Yi00YTU0LTg2YjktOTUzZTMwODJkOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjEyMmEwOTUtOTk1Yi00YTU0LTg2YjktOTUzZTMwODJkOTdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Focus Features","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000598/","name":"Dennis Quaid","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0371660/","name":"Dennis Haysbert"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042766/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030755/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001331/","name":"Todd Haynes"],"duration":"PT1H47M"</script><metacontent="
